content.raw:
Some of my thoughts:

* undo should be inverse of redo! yes - if we undo time then we should redo time 

* Simulation is running: I have no data to back this up but I still think having auto keyframe saving feature would have a performance hit. We don't know what machines the users have or how complex their scene is so it's hard to say its a corner case or not. We could have a checkbox that explicitly indicates whether `undo` will make keyframes or not, and they are given the option to turn it off. When turned off, undo will be a client-side action.

* When simulation is paused, I don't think we need to rewind back to previous keyframe, a client side undo may be sufficient. 

So.. we may need both options: client-side and keyframe-based undo. Sorry to add more work. I guess it's just a matter of which one should we support first.
